alert.note: Alert for Boone; Kanawha; Lincoln; Putnam (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 12 at 6:26PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Kanawha, southern Putnam, northeastern Lincoln and north central Boone Counties through 700 PM EDT... At 625 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Hurricane, or 8 miles northeast of Hamlin, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Charleston, Nitro, Jefferson, South Charleston, St. Albans, Dunbar, Hurricane, Poca, Cross Lanes, Alum Creek, Institute, Tornado, Teays Valley, Culloden and Sod. This includes the following highways... Interstate 79 between mile markers 1 and 3. Interstate 77 in West Virginia between mile markers 99 and 107. Interstate 64 in West Virginia between mile markers 32 and 57. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, seek shelter inside a building until the storms pass. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for central and western West Virginia.
